page.title: 15BIRDS OF ALL STRETTON
page.content: Birdlife in and around All Stretton is rich and varied. The area attracts many bird watchers. Two interesting birds found in and around streams in the valleys are the{Dippers}and the{Grey Wagtail.} Overhead can be seen{Buzzards}circling and looking for small creatures. Occasionaly{Raven}can be seen. On the lower slopes of the valleys the summer visiting birds can be heard. The{Chiffchaff}and{Willow {Warbler}sing in the trees. Further up, nesting in disused rabbit holes are the{Wheatears}and in the bracken{Whinchats}can be found. {Woodpeckers}and{Nuthatches}and {Treecreepers}are also found in the larger trees. Other birds spotted in the area include{Ring Ousels, Red Grouse, {Redstarts,}and{Peregrine Falcons.
